channel.title: [RuneSource/Azure] Skill Tutorials and More!

item.title: [RuneSource/Azure] Skill Tutorials and More!
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

Objects should only be static if they apply to single accessors. Like you run one instance of your server, so the socket listener port can be static, but for skills like the experience and timers shouldn’t be static as each player has their own instance of each.

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource/Azure] Skill Tutorials and More!
item.dc:creator: @TheHolyGrail TheHolyGrail
item.description:
@TheHolyGrail wrote:

[quote=“Advocatus, post:23, topic:421582”]@O.P. Don’t make varibles static that should be instanced per player. Most of these skills/ features will not work correctly if you have multiple people performing them.[/quote]Ok, thanks for the tip. Just made them all static because I was too lazy to see which should and shouldn’t be.

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource/Azure] Skill Tutorials and More!
item.dc:creator: @Advocatus Advocatus
item.description:
@Advocatus wrote:

Wintercanon:

What people should release is meta code on the algorithm they used for skilling, rather than their actual Java interpretations. That way others could easily write skill handlers using their own skills.

So true… I would post a topic with all the ones that I have found / use, but meh, on mopar it would get locked because its not a tutorial.

@O.P. Don’t make varibles static that should be instanced per player. Most of these skills/ features will not work correctly if you have multiple people performing them.

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource/Azure] Skill Tutorials and More!
item.dc:creator: @TheHolyGrail TheHolyGrail
item.description:
@TheHolyGrail wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:14, topic:421582”][quote author=TheHolyGrail link=topic=524239.msg3814918#msg3814918 date=1321235035]
And really? Didn’t know, always hated when people used just an isBusy boolean, but I guess I see why now.
[/quote]I don’t know what you’re talking about with an isBusy boolean…? No try get away with not using so many loops, though if you’re going to don’t create so many variables inside the loop, it’s a gc nightmare. I’ll show you an example:

int itemId = 0;
int itemQuantity = 0;
for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
    itemId = i * 2 + 4;
    itemQuantity = itemId * 10 + 40;
    player.addItemToBank(itemId, itemQuantity);
}

Is better to use than this:

for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
    int itemId = i * 2 + 4;
    int itemQuantity = itemId * 10 + 40;
    player.addItemToBank(itemId, itemQuantity);
}

It’s better to create two variables in the first chunk, rather than twenty as shown in the second chunk. By the way, this is dummy code, not usable to any specific source.[/quote]Ah ok, thanks for explaining that. Thought you were talking about something else at first.

Dummy code is a good thing? Or bad?

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource/Azure] Skill Tutorials and More!
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:14, topic:421582”][quote author=TheHolyGrail link=topic=524239.msg3814918#msg3814918 date=1321235035]
And really? Didn’t know, always hated when people used just an isBusy boolean, but I guess I see why now.
[/quote]I don’t know what you’re talking about with an isBusy boolean…? No try get away with not using so many loops, though if you’re going to don’t create so many variables inside the loop, it’s a gc nightmare. I’ll show you an example:

int itemId = 0;
int itemQuantity = 0;
for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
    itemId = i * 2 + 4;
    itemQuantity = itemId * 10 + 40;
    player.addItemToBank(itemId, itemQuantity);
}

Is better to use than this:

for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
    int itemId = i * 2 + 4;
    int itemQuantity = itemId * 10 + 40;
    player.addItemToBank(itemId, itemQuantity);
}

It’s better to create two variables in the first chunk, rather than twenty as shown in the second chunk. By the way, this is dummy code, not usable to any specific source.[/quote]
Oh, thank you for explaining. I was a bit stumped by what you had said, didn’t catch it before.

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource/Azure] Skill Tutorials and More!
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

[quote=“TheHolyGrail, post:12, topic:421582”]And really? Didn’t know, always hated when people used just an isBusy boolean, but I guess I see why now.[/quote]I don’t know what you’re talking about with an isBusy boolean…? No try get away with not using so many loops, though if you’re going to don’t create so many variables inside the loop, it’s a gc nightmare. I’ll show you an example:

int itemId = 0;
int itemQuantity = 0;
for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
    itemId = i * 2 + 4;
    itemQuantity = itemId * 10 + 40;
    player.addItemToBank(itemId, itemQuantity);
}

Is better to use than this:

for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
    int itemId = i * 2 + 4;
    int itemQuantity = itemId * 10 + 40;
    player.addItemToBank(itemId, itemQuantity);
}

It’s better to create two variables in the first chunk, rather than twenty as shown in the second chunk. By the way, this is dummy code, not usable to any specific source.

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource/Azure] Skill Tutorials and More!
item.dc:creator: @TheHolyGrail TheHolyGrail
item.description:
@TheHolyGrail wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:10, topic:421582”]You could have made a nicer use of enums vs the multidimensional constant arrays. Also running all those unnecessary loops which instance a lot of variables WILL be quite a performance bottleneck if a lot of players are skilling, especially in a single-threaded environment like RuneSource.[/quote]Yeah your right. I never used enums much, but I guess I should get into the habit of using them more often.

And really? Didn’t know, always hated when people used just an isBusy boolean, but I guess I see why now.

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource/Azure] Skill Tutorials and More!
item.dc:creator: @TheHolyGrail TheHolyGrail
item.description:
@TheHolyGrail wrote:

[quote=“pk2play, post:5, topic:421582”]Nice work[/quote]Thanks.

God I hate the 2000 character limit.

[size=14pt]Fletching[/size]

Features:

  • All bows with stringing
  • All arrows
  • Darts

You’ll need to find the interface id for the 2 items in the chatbox. Currently they all use the 3 item one and all woods can be used for shafts. You’ll also need to make the fletch x amount.

Make a new class called Fletching in your skills package and add this inside:

[code]package com.rs2.model.content.skills;

import com.rs2.model.World;
import com.rs2.model.players.Item;
import com.rs2.model.players.Player;
import com.rs2.model.players.GlobalObjectHandler;
import com.rs2.model.Position;
import com.rs2.model.tick.*;
import com.rs2.util.Misc;

/**

  • Gemini
  • Handles the fletching skill
  • @author Bradley Carels
    */

public class Fletching {

public static boolean isFletching = false;
public static int amount;
public static int type;
public static int log;

public static int[][] FLETCHING_DATA = {
//log id,item1,req1,exp1,item2,req2,exp2
{1511,50,5,5,48,10,10},
{1521,54,20,17,56,25,25},
{1519,60,35,33,58,40,42},
{1517,64,50,50,62,55,58},
{1515,68,65,68,66,70,75},
{1513,72,80,83,70,85,92}
};

public static int[][] STRINGING_DATA = {
//startId,endId,req,exp
{50,841,5,5},
{48,839,10,10},
{54,843,20,17},
{56,845,25,25},
{60,849,35,33},
{58,847,40,42},
{64,853,50,50},
{62,851,55,58},
{68,857,65,68},
{66,855,70,75},
{72,861,80,83},
{70,859,85,92}
};

public static int[][] ARROW_DATA = {
//startId,usedId,endId,req,exp
{52,314,53,1,1},
{53,39,882,1,3},
{53,40,884,15,4},
{53,41,886,30,6},
{53,42,888,45,9},
{53,43,890,60,11},
{53,44,892,75,14},
{314,819,806,1,2},
{314,820,807,22,4},
{314,821,808,37,8},
{314,822,809,52,11},
{314,823,810,67,15},
{314,824,811,81,20}
};

public static void startFletch(final Player player) {
    for (int[] data : FLETCHING_DATA) {
    final int logId = data[0];
    final int item1 = data[1];
    final int req1 = data[2];
    final int exp1 = data[3];
    final int item2 = data[4];
    final int req2 = data[5];
    final int exp2 = data[6];
    final Item name1 = new Item(item1, 1);
    final Item name2 = new Item(item2, 1);
    if (log == logId) {
	player.getActionSender().removeInterfaces();
	if (type == 1) {
	    if (player.getSkill().getLevelForXP(player.getSkill().getExp()[9]) < req1) {
		player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a Fletching level of " + req1 + " to make this.");
		return;
	    }
	} else {
	    if (player.getSkill().getLevelForXP(player.getSkill().getExp()[9]) < req2) {
		player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a Fletching level of " + req2 + " to make this.");
		return;
	    }
	}
	if (isFletching == true)
	    return;
	isFletching = true;
	player.getActionSender().sendSound(375, 0, 0);
	player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(1248,0);
	World.submit(new Tick(3){
	@Override
	    public void execute() {
		if (!player.getInventory().getItemContainer().contains(logId)) {
		    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You have run out of logs.");
		    stopFletch(player);
		    this.stop();
		    return;
		}
		if (type == 1) {
		    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You carefully cut the wood into a " + name1.getDefinition().getName().toLowerCase() + ".");
        		    player.getSkill().addExp(9, (exp1));
		    player.getInventory().removeItem(new Item(logId, 1));
        		    player.getInventory().addItem(new Item(item1, 1));
		} else {
		    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You carefully cut the wood into a " + name2.getDefinition().getName().toLowerCase() + ".");
        		    player.getSkill().addExp(9, (exp2));
		    player.getInventory().removeItem(new Item(logId, 1));
        		    player.getInventory().addItem(new Item(item2, 1));
		}
		if (amount > 0) {
		    amount --;
		}
		if (amount == 0 ) {
		    stopFletch(player);
		    this.stop();
		    return;
		}
		player.getActionSender().sendSound(375, 0, 0);
		player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(1248,0);
	    }
	});
    }
}
}

public static void makeShafts(final Player player) {
player.getActionSender().removeInterfaces();
if (isFletching == true)
    return;
isFletching = true;
player.getActionSender().sendSound(375, 0, 0);
player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(1248,0);
World.submit(new Tick(3){
@Override
    public void execute() {
	if (!player.getInventory().getItemContainer().contains(log)) {
	    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You have run out of logs.");
	    stopFletch(player);
	    this.stop();
	    return;
	}
	player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You carefully cut the wood into 15 arrow shafts.");
        	player.getSkill().addExp(9, 5);
	player.getInventory().removeItem(new Item(log, 1));
        	player.getInventory().addItem(new Item(52, 15));
	if (amount > 0) {
	    amount --;
	}
	if (amount == 0 ) {
	    stopFletch(player);
	    this.stop();
	    return;
	}
	player.getActionSender().sendSound(375, 0, 0);
	player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(1248,0);
    }
});
}

public static void makeArrows(final Player player, int used) {
for (int[] data : ARROW_DATA) {
    int startId = data[0];
    int usedId = data[1];
    int endId = data[2];
    int req = data[3];
    int exp = data[4];
    if (used == usedId) {
	Item item1 = new Item(usedId, 1);
	Item item2 = new Item(startId, 1);
	player.getActionSender().removeInterfaces();
	if (player.getSkill().getLevelForXP(player.getSkill().getExp()[9]) < req) {
	    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a Fletching level of " + req + " to make this.");
	    return;
	}
	if (isFletching == true)
	    return;
	player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You attach the " + item1.getDefinition().getName().toLowerCase() + " to the " + item2.getDefinition().getName().toLowerCase() + ".");
	if (player.getInventory().getItemContainer().getCount(usedId) > 15
	    && player.getInventory().getItemContainer().getCount(startId) > 15) {
	    player.getSkill().addExp(9, exp*15);
	    player.getInventory().removeItem(new Item(startId, 15));
	    player.getInventory().removeItem(new Item(usedId, 15));
	    player.getInventory().addItem(new Item(endId, 15));
	} else {
	    int amnt = 0;
	    if (player.getInventory().getItemContainer().getCount(startId) 
		> player.getInventory().getItemContainer().getCount(usedId)) {
		amnt = player.getInventory().getItemContainer().getCount(usedId);
	    } else {
		amnt = player.getInventory().getItemContainer().getCount(startId);
	    }
	    player.getSkill().addExp(9, exp*amnt);
	    player.getInventory().removeItem(new Item(startId, amnt));
	    player.getInventory().removeItem(new Item(usedId, amnt));
	    player.getInventory().addItem(new Item(endId, amnt));
	}
    }
}
}

public static void finishBow(Player player, int start) {
for (int[] data : STRINGING_DATA) {
    int startId = data[0];
    int endId = data[1];
    int req = data[2];
    int exp = data[3];
    if (start == startId) {
	Item item = new Item(startId, 1);
	player.getActionSender().removeInterfaces();
	if (player.getSkill().getLevelForXP(player.getSkill().getExp()[9]) < req) {
	    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a Fletching level of " + req + " to make this.");
	    return;
	}
	//if (isFletching == true)
	    //return;
	player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You attach the bow string to the " + item.getDefinition().getName().toLowerCase() + ".");
	player.getSkill().addExp(9, exp);
	player.getInventory().removeItem(new Item(startId, 1));
	player.getInventory().removeItem(new Item(1777, 1));
	player.getInventory().addItem(new Item(endId, 1));
    }
}
}

public static boolean handleButtons(Player player, int buttonId) {
switch(buttonId) {
    case 34185:
	type = 1;
	amount = 1;
	startFletch(player);
	return true;
    case 34184:
	type = 1;
	amount = 5;
	startFletch(player);
	return true;
    case 34183:
	type = 1;
	amount = 10;
	startFletch(player);
	return true;
    case 34189:
	type = 0;
	amount = 1;
	startFletch(player);
	return true;
    case 34188:
	type = 0;
	amount = 5;
	startFletch(player);
	return true;
    case 34187:
	type = 0;
	amount = 10;
	startFletch(player);
	return true;
    case 34193:
	amount = 1;
	makeShafts(player);
	return true;
    case 34192:
	amount = 5;
	makeShafts(player);
	return true;
    case 34191:
	amount = 10;
	makeShafts(player);
	return true;
}
return false;
}

public static void openFletchInterface(final Player player, int log) {
    for (int[] data : FLETCHING_DATA) {
    int logId = data[0];
    int item1 = data[1];
    int item2 = data[4];
    Item name1 = new Item(item1, 1);
    Item name2 = new Item(item2, 1);
    if (logId == log) {
	if (logId == 1511) {
	    player.getActionSender().sendChatInterface(8880);
	    player.getActionSender().sendItemOnInterface(8885, 250, 52);
	    player.getActionSender().sendString("Arrow Shafts", 8897);
	    player.getActionSender().sendString("What would you like to make?", 8879);
	    player.getActionSender().sendItemOnInterface(8884, 250, item2);
	    player.getActionSender().sendItemOnInterface(8883, 250, item1);
	    player.getActionSender().sendString(name1.getDefinition().getName(), 8889);
	    player.getActionSender().sendString(name2.getDefinition().getName(), 8893);
	} else {
	    player.getActionSender().sendChatInterface(8880);
	    player.getActionSender().sendString("What would you like to make?", 8879);
	    player.getActionSender().sendItemOnInterface(8885, 250, item2);
	    player.getActionSender().sendItemOnInterface(8883, 250, item1);
	    player.getActionSender().sendString(name1.getDefinition().getName(), 8889);
	    player.getActionSender().sendString(name2.getDefinition().getName(), 8897);
	    player.getActionSender().sendString(" ", 8893);
	    player.getActionSender().sendItemOnInterface(8884, 250, -1);
	}
    }
}
}

public static void stopFletch(Player player) {
player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(65535,0);
amount = 0;
type = 0;
log = 0;
isFletching = false;
}

public static boolean handleFletching(Player player, Item useItem, Item useWithItem, int slot, int useSlot) {
    int item = useItem.getId();
    int usedItem = useWithItem.getId();
    for (int[] data : FLETCHING_DATA) {
        int logId = data[0];
        if (item == logId && usedItem == 946 || item == 946 && usedItem == logId) {
	log = logId;
	openFletchInterface(player, logId);
            return true;
        }
    }
for (int[] data : STRINGING_DATA) {
        int start = data[0];
        if (item == start && usedItem == 1777 || item == 1777 && usedItem == start) {
	finishBow(player, start);
            return true;
        }
}
for (int[] data : ARROW_DATA) {
        int startId = data[0];
    int usedId = data[1];
        if (item == startId && usedItem == usedId || item == usedId && usedItem == startId) {
	makeArrows(player, usedId);
            return true;
        }
}
    return false;
}

}[/code]

ButtonPacketHandler.java under

add:

if (Fletching.handleButtons(player, buttonId)) return;

ItemPacketHandler.java under

Item useItem = player.getInventory().getItemContainer().get(slot); Item useWithItem = player.getInventory().getItemContainer().get(withSlot);
add:

if (Fletching.handleFletching(player, useItem, useWithItem, slot, withSlot)) { return; }

MovementHandler.java under

if (direction > -1) { waypoints.add(new Point(x, y, direction)); }
add:

if (Fletching.isFletching == true) { Fletching.stopFletch(player); }

Don’t forget the imports:

Read full topic

item.title: [RuneSource/Azure] Skill Tutorials and More!
item.dc:creator: @TheHolyGrail TheHolyGrail
item.description:
@TheHolyGrail wrote:

Thanks guys.

Mores coming: Crafting, Cooking, Water Fillabes, and some other skills aswell. Just takes a while to make the tutorials for each lol. >.<

[size=14pt]Crafting[/size]

Features:

  • Full Gem Cutting
  • Full Leather Crafting (not hardleather)

You’ll need to add the craft x amount, didn’t get around to doing it.

Make a new class called Crafting in your skills package and add this inside:

[code]package com.rs2.model.content.skills;

import com.rs2.model.World;
import com.rs2.model.players.Item;
import com.rs2.model.players.Player;
import com.rs2.model.players.GlobalObjectHandler;
import com.rs2.model.Position;
import com.rs2.model.tick.*;
import com.rs2.util.Misc;

/**

  • Xalion
  • Handles the crafting skill
  • @author Bradley Carels
    */

public class Crafting {

public static boolean isCrafting = false;
private static int amount;

public static int[][] GEMS = {
{1623,1607,50,1},
{1621,1605,68,27},
{1619,1603,85,34},
{1617,1601,108,43},
{1631,1615,138,55}
};

public static int[][] LEATHER = {
//starting item, end item, exp, req
{1059,14,1},
{1061,16,7},
{1167,19,9},
{1063,22,11},
{1129,25,14},
{1095,27,18}
};

public static void cutGem(final Player player, int gemId) {
for (int[] data: GEMS) {
    final int gem = data[0];
    final int cut = data[1];
    final int exp = data[2];
    int req = data[3];
    if (gem == gemId) {
	    isCrafting = true;
	    player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(885,0);
	    player.getActionSender().sendSound(464, 1, 0);
	    World.submit(new Tick(4){
	    @Override
		public void execute() {
		    if (isCrafting == false) {
			stopCrafting(player);
			this.stop();
		    }
		    if (player.getInventory().getItemContainer().contains(gem)) {
			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You cut the gem.");
			player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(885,0);
			player.getActionSender().sendSound(464, 1, 0);
        			player.getSkill().addExp(12, (exp));
			player.getInventory().removeItem(new Item(gem, 1));
			player.getInventory().addItem(new Item(cut, 1));
		    } else {
			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("There are no more gems left to cut.");
			stopCrafting(player);
			this.stop();
		    }
		    if (amount > 0) {
			amount --;
		    }
		}
	    });
	}
}
}

public static void craftLeather(final Player player, int id) {
for (int[] data: LEATHER) {
    final int end = data[0];
    final int exp = data[1];
    final int req = data[2];
    if (end == id) {
	final Item item = new Item(end, 1);
            if (player.getSkill().getLevelForXP(player.getSkill().getExp()[12]) < req) {
                player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a Crafting level of " + req + " to make this item.");
                return;
            }
	if (isCrafting == true)
	    return;
	if (!player.getInventory().getItemContainer().contains(1734)) {
	    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You don't have any thread.");
	    return;
	}
	isCrafting = true;
	player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(1249,0);
	    World.submit(new Tick(4){
	    @Override
		public void execute() {
		    if (isCrafting == false) {
			stopCrafting(player);
			this.stop();
		    }
		    if (player.getInventory().getItemContainer().contains(1734)) {
			if (player.getInventory().getItemContainer().contains(1741)) {
			    if (amount > 0) {
				amount --;
			    }
			    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You make a pair of " + item.getDefinition().getName().toLowerCase() + ".");
			    player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(1249,0);
        			    player.getSkill().addExp(12, (exp));
			    player.getInventory().removeItem(new Item(1741, 1));
			    player.getInventory().addItem(new Item(end, 1));
			    if (player.random(4) == 1) {
				player.getInventory().removeItem(new Item(1734, 1));
			    }
			    if (amount == 0) {
				stopCrafting(player);
				this.stop();
			    }
		        } else {
			    if (amount > 0) {
				player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You have run out of leather.");
			    }
			    stopCrafting(player);
			    this.stop();
			}
		    } else {
			if (amount > 0) {
			    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You have run out of thread.");
			}
			stopCrafting(player);
			this.stop();
		    }
		}
	    });
    }
}
	
}

public static boolean handleButtons(Player player, int buttonId) {
switch(buttonId) {
    case 33190:
	amount = 1;
	craftLeather(player, 1059);
	return true;
    case 33189:
	amount = 5;
	craftLeather(player, 1059);
	return true;
    case 33188:
	amount = 10;
	craftLeather(player, 1059);
	return true;
    case 33193:
	amount = 1;
	craftLeather(player, 1061);
	return true;
    case 33192:
	amount = 5;
	craftLeather(player, 1061);
	return true;
    case 33191:
	amount = 10;
	craftLeather(player, 1061);
	return true;
    case 33196:
	amount = 1;
	craftLeather(player, 1063);
	return true;
    case 33195:
	amount = 5;
	craftLeather(player, 1063);
	return true;
    case 33194:
	amount = 10;
	craftLeather(player, 1063);
	return true;
    case 33205:
	amount = 1;
	craftLeather(player, 1167);
	return true;
    case 33204:
	amount = 5;
	craftLeather(player, 1167);
	return true;
    case 33203:
	amount = 10;
	craftLeather(player, 1167);
	return true;
    case 33199:
	amount = 1;
	craftLeather(player, 1095);
	return true;
    case 33198:
	amount = 5;
	craftLeather(player, 1095);
	return true;
    case 33197:
	amount = 10;
	craftLeather(player, 1095);
	return true;
    case 33187:
	amount = 1;
	craftLeather(player, 1129);
	return true;
    case 33186:
	amount = 5;
	craftLeather(player, 1129);
	return true;
    case 33185:
	amount = 10;
	craftLeather(player, 1129);
	return true;
}
return false;
}

public static void stopCrafting(Player player) {
isCrafting = false;
amount = 0;
player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(65535,0);
}

public static boolean handleCrafting(Player player, Item useItem, Item useWithItem, int slot, int useSlot) {
    int item = useItem.getId();
    int usedItem = useWithItem.getId();
    for (int[] data : GEMS) {
        int gem = data[0];
    int req = data[3];
        if (item == gem && usedItem == 1755 || item == 1755 && usedItem == gem) {
            if (player.getSkill().getLevelForXP(player.getSkill().getExp()[12]) < req) {
                player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a Crafting level of " + req + " to cut this gem.");
                return false;
            }
	cutGem(player, gem);
            return true;
        }
    }
for (int[] data: LEATHER) {
    int end = data[0];
    if (item == 1733 && usedItem == 1741 || item == 1741 && usedItem == 1733) {
	player.getActionSender().sendInterface(2311);
    }
}
if (item == 1733 && usedItem == 1743 || item == 1743 && usedItem == 1733) {
    player.getActionSender().sendChatInterface(4429);
    player.getActionSender().sendItemOnInterface(4429, 250, 1743); // middle
}
    return false;
}

}[/code]

ButtonPacketHandler.java under

add:

if (Crafting.handleButtons(player, buttonId)) return;

ItemPacketHandler.java under

Item useItem = player.getInventory().getItemContainer().get(slot); Item useWithItem = player.getInventory().getItemContainer().get(withSlot);
add:

if (Crafting.handleCrafting(player, useItem, useWithItem, slot, withSlot)) { return; }

In MovementHandler.java under

if (direction > -1) { waypoints.add(new Point(x, y, direction)); }
add:

if (Crafting.isCrafting == true) Crafting.stopCrafting(player);

Don’t forget the imports:

item.title: [RuneSource/Azure] Skill Tutorials and More!
item.dc:creator: @TheHolyGrail TheHolyGrail
item.description:
@TheHolyGrail wrote:

Hey everyone. I just really don’t like Azure/Runesource, no offence to those who use it. It just doesn’t suit me.

Due to me switching from Azure to Hyperion for my remake, I’ll be releasing my skills and other things that were developed over the past couple of weeks.

Hopefully this will help to get more people to move on from the dreaded PI. ;o

Please note none of these are half-assed and were done to the best of my ability.

[SIZE=4]Woodcutting[/SIZE]

Features:

  • All axes
  • Correct stumps, timers, dying and respawning
  • All basic trees with correct exp rates, logs, whatever. xD

You’ll need to make the trees have health, and in which are depleted when they are being cut. Currently they are randomly cut down.

Make a new class called Woodcutting in your skills package and add this inside:

[code]package com.rs2.model.content.skills;

import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Arrays;

import com.rs2.model.World;
import com.rs2.model.players.Item;
import com.rs2.model.players.Player;
import com.rs2.model.players.GlobalObject;
import com.rs2.model.players.GlobalObjectHandler;
import com.rs2.model.players.container.Container;
import com.rs2.model.Position;
import com.rs2.model.tick.*;
import com.rs2.util.Misc;

/**

  • Xalion
  • Handles the woodcutting skill
  • @author Bradley Carels
    */

public class Woodcutting {

private static int hasAxe = -1;
private static int animId = -1;
private static int treeId = -1;
public static int wcTimer = -1;
private static int treeTyp = -1;
private static int stump = -1;
private static int spawnTime = -1;
private static boolean removed;
public static boolean isWoodcutting = false;

private static GlobalObject deadTree;
private static GlobalObject regTree;

private static int[][] TREES = {
//treeTypes: 0=normal, 1=normal2, 2=oak, 3=willow, 4=maple, 5=yew, 6=magic
//treeType, log given, lvlreq, exp, stump, respawn time
{0, 1511, 1, 25, 1342, 45},
{1, 1511, 1, 25, 1343, 45},
{2, 1521, 15, 38, 1355, 12},
{3, 1519, 30, 68, 7399, 12},
{4, 1517, 45, 100, 7400, 55},
{5, 1515, 60, 175, 7402, 90},
{6, 1513, 75, 250, 7401, 175}
};
private static int[] AXES = {1351, 1349, 1353, 1361, 1355, 1357, 1359};
//private static int[] ANIMS = {879, 877, 875, 873, 871, 869, 867};
private static int[] REQS = {1, 1, 6, 6, 21, 31, 41};

public static void checkForAxe(Player player) {
    for (int j = AXES.length - 1; j >= 0; j--) {
    Container equip = player.getEquipment().getItemContainer();
    if (!player.getInventory().getItemContainer().contains(AXES[j])) {
	if (equip.contains(AXES[j])) {
	    if (REQS[j] <= player.getSkill().getLevelForXP(player.getSkill().getExp()[8])) {
		hasAxe = AXES[j];
    	    } else {
		player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You do not have an axe which you have the woodcutting level to use.");
	    }
    	}
    }
}

    for (int j = AXES.length - 1; j >= 0; j--) {
    Item weapon = player.getEquipment().getItemContainer().get(3);
    if (player.getInventory().getItemContainer().contains(AXES[j])) {
	if (player.getSkill().getLevelForXP(player.getSkill().getExp()[8]) >= REQS[j]) {
	    hasAxe = AXES[j];
    	} else {
	    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You do not have an axe which you have the woodcutting level to use.");
    	}
    }
}

if (hasAxe == 1349) {
    animId = 879;
} else if (hasAxe == 1351) {
    animId = 877;
} else if (hasAxe == 1353) {
    animId = 875;
} else if (hasAxe ==  1361) {
    animId = 873;
} else if (hasAxe == 1355) {
    animId = 871;
} else if (hasAxe == 1357) {
    animId = 869;
} else if (hasAxe == 1359) {
    animId = 867;
}

}

public static void cutTree(final Player player, int tree) {
    for (int[] data : TREES) {
        final int treeType = data[0];
        int logReturn = data[1];
        int lvlReq = data[2];
        final int exp = data[3];

    treeTyp = tree;

        if (tree == treeType) {
            if (lvlReq > player.getSkill().getLevelForXP(player.getSkill().getExp()[8])) {
                player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a woodcutting level of " + lvlReq + " to cut this tree.");
                return;
            }
            final Item item = new Item(logReturn, 1);
    	checkForAxe(player);
	if (hasAxe > 0) {
	    if(player.getInventory().getItemContainer().freeSlot() == -1) {
		player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Your inventory is too full to hold any more logs.");
		return;
	    }
	    player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(animId, 0);
	    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You swing your axe at the tree.");
	    isWoodcutting = true;
		World.submit(new Tick(4){
		@Override
		    public void execute() {
			if (isWoodcutting == true) {
			    player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(animId, 0);
        			    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You get some " + item.getDefinition().getName().toLowerCase() + ".");
        			    player.getSkill().addExp(8, (exp));
        			    player.getInventory().addItem(item);
			    hasAxe = -1;
			    if (player.random(10) == 7|| player.random(10) == 3) {
				removeTree(player, player.getClickX(), player.getClickY());
				stopCutting(player);
				this.stop();
			    }
			    if(player.getInventory().getItemContainer().freeSlot() == -1 && treeType > 1) {
				player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Your inventory is too full to hold any more logs.");
				stopCutting(player);
				this.stop();
			    }
			    if (treeType <= 1) {
				stopCutting(player);
				removeTree(player, player.getClickX(), player.getClickY());
				this.stop();
			    }
			} else {
			    this.stop();
			}
		    }
		});
	} else {
	    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need an axe to chop down this tree.");
	}
        }
    }
}

public static void stopCutting(Player player) {
player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(65535,0);
hasAxe = -1;
isWoodcutting = false;
}

public static void spawnTree(final Player player) {
    for (int[] data : TREES) {
        final int treeType = data[0];
        final int respawn = data[5];

	    if (treeTyp == 0) {
		treeId = 1276;
	    } else if (treeTyp == 1) {
		treeId = 1278;
	    } else if (treeTyp == 2) {
		treeId = 1281;
	    } else if (treeTyp == 3) {
		treeId = 1308;
	    } else if (treeTyp == 4) {
		treeId = 1307;
	    } else if (treeTyp == 5) {
		treeId = 1309;
	    } else if (treeTyp == 6) {
		treeId = 1306;
	    }


	World.submit(new Tick(4){
	@Override
	    public void execute() {
    		//GlobalObjectHandler.createObject(player, treeId, new Position(player.getClickX(), player.getClickY()), 0, 10);
		deadTree = new GlobalObject(treeId, new Position(player.getClickX(), player.getClickY(), 0), 0, 10);
		player.getActionSender().sendObject(deadTree);
		this.stop();
	    }
	});
}
}

public static void removeTree(final Player player, final int x, final int y) {
    for (int[] data : TREES) {
        final int treeType = data[0];
        final int respawn = data[5];

	    if (treeTyp == 0) {
		stump = 1342;
		treeId = 1276;
		spawnTime = 30+Misc.random(30);
	    } else if (treeTyp == 1) {
		stump = 1343;
		treeId = 1278;
		spawnTime = 30+Misc.random(30);
	    } else if (treeTyp == 2) {
		stump = 1355;
		treeId = 1281;
		spawnTime = 13;
	    } else if (treeTyp == 3) {
		stump = 7399;
		treeId = 1308;
		spawnTime = 13;
	    } else if (treeTyp == 4) {
		stump = 7400;
		treeId = 1307;
		spawnTime = 60;
	    } else if (treeTyp == 5) {
		stump = 7402;
		treeId = 1309;
		spawnTime = 97;
	    } else if (treeTyp == 6) {
		stump = 7401;
		treeId = 1306;
		spawnTime = 190;
	    }

    //if (removed == true)
	//return;
    //GlobalObjectHandler.createObject(player, stump, new Position(player.getClickX(), player.getClickY()), 0, 10);
    regTree = new GlobalObject(stump, new Position(player.getClickX(), player.getClickY(), 0), 0, 10);
    //removed = true;
    player.getActionSender().sendObject(regTree);
    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You chop down the tree.");
    World.submit(new Tick(spawnTime) {
	@Override
	public void execute() {
	    deadTree = new GlobalObject(treeId, new Position(x, y, 0), 0, 10);
	    player.getActionSender().sendObject(deadTree);
	    this.stop();
	}
    });
    //spawnTree(player);
}

}

}[/code]

Go into WalkToActions.java

In the FirstClickObject void under the switch statement add:

/** * Woodcutting */ case 1276: // normal tree Woodcutting.cutTree(player, 0); break; case 1278: // normal tree2 Woodcutting.cutTree(player, 1); break; case 1281: // oak Woodcutting.cutTree(player, 2); break; case 1308: // willow Woodcutting.cutTree(player, 3); break; case 1307: // maple Woodcutting.cutTree(player, 4); break; case 1309: // yew Woodcutting.cutTree(player, 5); break; case 1306: // magic tree Woodcutting.cutTree(player, 6); break;

WalkPacketHandler.java under

if (!player.getMovementHandler().canWalk()) { return; }
add:

if (Woodcutting.isWoodcutting == true) { Woodcutting.stopCutting(player); }

I think that’s it. If you get any errors or see somethings missing please post below.

[size=4]Cow Milking[/size]

In src\com\rs2\model\content make a new class called CowMilking and add this inside:

[code]package com.rs2.model.content;

import java.util.Arrays;
import java.util.List;

import com.rs2.model.Position;
import com.rs2.model.World;
import com.rs2.model.players.Item;
import com.rs2.model.players.Player;
import com.rs2.model.tick.Tick;

/**

  • Xalion
  • Milking cows
  • @author Bradley Carels
    */

public class CowMilking {

public static boolean isMilkingCow = false;

public static void milkCow(final Player player) {
if (player.getInventory().getItemContainer().contains(1925)) {
    isMilkingCow = true;
    player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(2305,0);
    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You begin to milk the cow.");
    World.submit(new Tick(4){
    @Override
	public void execute() {
	    if (isMilkingCow == false) {
		this.stop();
		return;
	    }
	    if (player.getInventory().getItemContainer().contains(1925)) {
		player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You fill your bucket with milk.");
		player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(2305,0);
		player.getInventory().removeItem(new Item(1925, 1));
		player.getInventory().addItem(new Item(1927, 1));
	    } else {
		player.getActionSender().sendMessage("There you have no buckets left to fill.");
		stopMilking(player);
		this.stop();
	    }
	}
    });
} else {
    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a bucket to milk a cow.");
}
}

public static void stopMilking(Player player) {
player.getUpdateFlags().sendAnimation(65535,0);
isMilkingCow = false;
}

}[/code]

Go into WalkToActions.java

In the FirstClickObject void under the switch statement add:

case 8689: CowMilking.milkCow(player); break;

In MovementHandler.java under

if (direction > -1) { waypoints.add(new Point(x, y, direction)); }
add:

if (CowMilking.isMilkingCow == true) CowMilking.stopMilking(player);

Don’t forget the imports:

Will be releasing more, be patient as I add them.

Please give feedback and give credits if you use.

Read full topic
